techmeme.title: Sources: Google recently approached EssilorLuxottica's leadership about putting its Gemini AI assistant in future smart glasses (Alex Heath/The Verge)
A profile of CrowdStrike, founded in 2011 and used by 300 companies in the Fortune 500; Gartner: CrowdStrike has ~15% of the global security software market (Robert McMillan/Wall Street Journal)
Disney announces that Safra Catz, CEO of Oracle, is departing its board of directors after six years (Todd Spangler/Variety)
CrowdStrike shares close down 11.1% after a software update caused a major outage; its shares had previously risen nearly 118% in the last 12 months (Ryan Browne/CNBC)
Michael Moritz urges Biden to drop out, joining other tech leaders such as Reed Hastings and the Zynga co-founder Mark Pincus in calling for Biden to step aside (New York Times)
